alert.note: Alert for Pulaski; Saline (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 14 at 12:58AM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Saline and central Pulaski Counties through 130 AM CDT... At 1257 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles north of Salem in Saline County, or 10 miles west of West Little Rock, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Little Rock... North Little Rock... Benton... Sherwood... West Little Rock... Maumelle... Bryant... Downtown Little Rock... Southwest Little Rock... North Little Rock Airport... Argenta... Otter Creek... Burns Park... Marche... Chenal Valley... Oak Grove in Pulaski County... Protho Junction... Gibson... Sweet Home... Lakewood... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 600 AM CDT for central Arkansas.
